physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure 73/42 mm Hg; hyponatremia 123 mmol/liter; hyperkalemia 6.7 mmol/liter
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: During the first 2 months, the child presented with poor growth. At age 3 months, the child exhibited vomiting, dehydration, hypotension, and electrolyte imbalances.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially presented normal, but at 3 months exhibited acute crises including vomiting and dehydration.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Hyponatremia 120 mmol/liter; hyperkalemia 6.5 mmol/liter; cortisol 346 nmol/liter; elevated ACTH greater than 275 pmol/liter; plasma renin activity levels of 45 nmol/liter.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Clinical examination revealed normal female external genitalia with mild hyperpigmentation of the labia majora. Further investigation confirmed bilateral adrenal hyperplasia.
